sentence.Network_en: Any evidence of collusive behaviour by the banks could be sent to the Office of Fair Trading.
sentence.Network_cn: 任何能证明银行有串通行为的证据都可以送交公平贸易部。

sentence.Network_en: Pricing decisions made in a collusive atmosphere come close to monopoly pricing.
sentence.Network_cn: 在勾结的情况下制定的价格,接近于垄断价格.

sentence.Network_en: Collusive price leadership characterizes oligopolistic markets.
sentence.Network_cn: 串通式价格领导具有寡占市场的特征.

entry.tran: (尤指国家、组织间)共谋的，勾结的，串通的
entry.def: Collusive behaviour involves secret or illegal co-operation, especially between countries or organizations.

example.ex: Any evidence of collusive behaviour by the banks could be sent to the Office of Fair Trading.
example.tran: 任何能证明银行有串通行为的证据都可以送交公平贸易部。

means.word_mean: 1. acting together in secret toward a fraudulent or illegal end

auth_sentence.content: One is the rise of collusive capitalism.
auth_sentence.res_content: One is the rise of collusive capitalism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One is the rise of collusive capitalism.

auth_sentence.content: Collusive capitalism has become visible to the public and increasingly defines capitalism in the public mind.
auth_sentence.res_content: Collusive capitalism has become visible to the public and increasingly defines capitalism in the public mind.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Collusive capitalism has become visible to the public and increasingly defines capitalism in the public mind.

auth_sentence.content: But many like-minded novels have fallen into cheap joking, and clever, collusive ironies.
